entry.et: Latin operatus, past participle of operari to work, from oper-, opus work; akin to Old English efnan to perform, Sanskrit apas work

def.dt: :to perform a function :exert power or influence factors operating against our success
:to produce an appropriate effect the drug operated quickly
:to perform an operation or a series of operations
:to carry on a military or naval action or mission
:to follow a course of conduct that is often irregular crooked gamblers operating in the club
